pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:0.5.eng: The training rule on cleaning with water

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country in the Banyan Tree Monastery at Kapilavatthu,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.1.2.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpati gotamī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā adhovāte aṭṭhāsi—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.1.2.eng: Mahāpajāpati Gotamī went to him and bowed. Standing downwind from him, she said,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.1.5.pli: “ādiyantu kho bhikkhuniyo udakasuddhikan”ti, mahāpajāpatiṃ gotamiṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.1.5.eng: “Well then, the nuns should clean themselves with water.” And the Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened her with a teaching,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.1.6.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpati gotamī bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.1.6.eng: after which she bowed down, circumambulated him with her right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.1.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.1.7.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.1.8.eng: “Monks, I allow the nuns to clean themselves with water.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.1.eng: Being aware that the Buddha had allowed cleaning with water,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.2.pli: “bhagavatā udakasuddhikā anuññātā”ti atigambhīraṃ udakasuddhikaṃ ādiyantī muttakaraṇe vaṇaṃ akāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.2.eng: a nun did it too deeply, causing a sore in her vagina.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.3.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ āroceti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.3.eng: She told the nuns what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.4.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.4.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.5.eng: “How could a nun clean herself too deeply with water?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī atigambhīraṃ udakasuddhikaṃ ādiyatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.6.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.9.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī atigambhīraṃ udakasuddhikaṃ ādiyissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.9.eng: “How could a nun clean herself too deeply with water?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.11.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.11.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.12.1.pli: “Udakasuddhikaṃ pana bhikkhuniyā ādiyamānāya dvaṅgulapabbaparamaṃ ādātabbaṃ. Taṃ atikkāmentiyā pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:1.2.12.1.eng: ‘If a nun is cleaning herself with water, she may insert two finger joints at the most. If she goes further than that, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.1.2.eng: rinsing the vagina is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.1.5.eng: She may insert two finger joints at the most:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.1.6.eng: she may insert two joints of two fingers at the most.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.1.7.eng: If she goes further than that:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.1.8.pli: samphassaṃ sādiyantī antamaso kesaggamattampi atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.1.8.eng: if she consents to the contact and goes further even by a hair’s breadth, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.2.1.eng: If it is more than two finger joints, and she perceives it as more, and she inserts them, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.2.2.eng: If it is more than two finger joints, but she is unsure of it, and she inserts them, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.2.3.eng: If it is more than two finger joints, but she perceives it as less, and she inserts them, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.2.4.eng: If it is less than two finger joints, but she perceives it as more, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.2.5.eng: If it is less than two finger joints, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.2.6.eng: If it is less than two finger joints, and she perceives it as less, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.3.2.eng: if she inserts two finger joints;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.3.3.eng: if she inserts less than two finger joints;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.3.4.eng: if she does it because she is sick;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.3.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc5:2.3.7.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:0.5.eng: The training rule on teaching worldly subjects

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo tiracchānavijjaṃ vācenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns from the group of six were teaching worldly subjects.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo tiracchānavijjaṃ vācessanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.4.eng: “How can the nuns teach worldly subjects? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.6.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.7.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo tiracchānavijjaṃ vācentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo tiracchānavijjaṃ vācessanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.11.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun teaches worldly subjects, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:2.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:2.6.eng: whatever is external to the Buddha’s Teaching, not connected with the goal.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:2.8.pli: padena vāceti, pade pade āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:2.8.eng: if she teaches by the line, then for every line she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:2.9.eng: If she teaches by the syllable, then for every syllable she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:2.12.comm: Dhāraṇa normally means “remembering”, but in the present context this does not fit. Here it is probably used in the sense of dhāraṇī, a verse, charm, or prayer used for protection, see SED. In this sense it is a near synonym for paritta.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:2.13.eng: if she teaches verses for the purpose of protection;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:2.15.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:2.16.eng: The tenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc50:2.17.eng: The fifth subchapter on pleasure houses is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:0.5.eng: The training rule on entering monasteries

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū gāmakāvāse ekacīvarā cīvarakammaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.2.eng: a number of monks dressed only in sarongs were making robes in a certain village monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.3.pli: Bhikkhuniyo anāpucchā ārāmaṃ pavisitvā yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.3.eng: Nuns entered that monastery without asking permission and approached those monks.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.4.eng: The monks complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.5.eng: “How can nuns enter a monastery without asking permission?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo anāpucchā ārāmaṃ pavisantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.6.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did that?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.9.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo anāpucchā ārāmaṃ pavisissanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.11.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.11.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.12.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī anāpucchā ārāmaṃ paviseyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.12.1.eng: ‘If a nun enters a monastery without asking permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.13.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.13.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena te bhikkhū tamhā āvāsā pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards those monks left that monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.2.eng: But even though the nuns had heard that the monks had left, they did not go there.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.3.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū punadeva taṃ āvāsaṃ paccāgacchiṃsu.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.4.pli: Bhikkhuniyo—“ayyā āgatā”ti āpucchā ārāmaṃ pavisitvā yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkamiṃsu;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.4.eng: When the nuns heard that this was the case, they asked permission and then entered that monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.5.pli: upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.5.eng: They approached the monks and bowed down to them.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho tā bhikkhuniyo te bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—“kissa tumhe, bhaginiyo, ārāmaṃ neva sammajjittha na pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpitthā”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.6.eng: The monks then said to them, “Sisters, why didn’t you sweep the monastery, or put out water for drinking or water for washing?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.7.pli: “Bhagavatā, ayyā, sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ—‘na anāpucchā ārāmo pavisitabbo’ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.7.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule that we may not enter a monastery without asking permission.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.8.eng: That’s why we didn’t do it.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.9.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.10.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, santaṃ bhikkhuṃ āpucchā ārāmaṃ pavisituṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.10.eng: “Monks, when a monk is available, a nun should enter a monastery only after asking permission.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.11.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.11.eng: And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.12.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā ārāmaṃ paviseyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.12.1.eng: ‘If a nun, when a monk is available, enters a monastery without asking permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.13.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.13.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena te bhikkhū tamhā āvāsā pakkamitvā punadeva taṃ āvāsaṃ paccāgacchiṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.1.eng: After leaving that monastery once more, the monks returned yet again.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.2.eng: Thinking that the monks were still away, the nuns entered the monastery without asking permission.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.3.pli: Tāsaṃ kukkuccaṃ ahosi—“bhagavatā sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ—‘na santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā ārāmo pavisitabbo’ti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.4.pli: Mayañcamhā santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā ārāmaṃ pavisimhā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.4.eng: “We have entered a monastery without asking permission, even though a monk was available. And the Buddha has laid down a training rule against this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.5.pli: Kacci nu kho mayaṃ pācittiyaṃ āpattiṃ āpannā”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.5.eng: Could it be that we have committed an offense entailing confession?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.7.eng: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.8.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.8.eng: “And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.9.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ sabhikkhukaṃ ārāmaṃ anāpucchā paviseyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.9.1.eng: ‘If a nun, knowing that there are monks in a monastery, enters it without asking permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.6.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti, aññe vā tassā ārocenti, te vā ārocenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.6.eng: she knows it by herself or others have told her or they have told her.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.6.comm: The last of these three ways of knowing presumably refers to the monks themselves having told the nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.7.eng: There are monks in a monastery:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.8.eng: even where monks stay at the foot of a tree.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.10.pli: bhikkhuṃ vā sāmaṇeraṃ vā ārāmikaṃ vā anāpucchā parikkhittassa ārāmassa parikkhepaṃ atikkāmentiyā āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.10.eng: if she crosses the boundary of an enclosed monastery without asking permission of a monk or a novice monk or a monastery worker, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.11.pli: Aparikkhittassa ārāmassa upacāraṃ okkamantiyā āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.11.eng: If she enters the vicinity of an unenclosed monastery, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.1.pli: Sabhikkhuke sabhikkhukasaññā santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā ārāmaṃ pavisati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.1.eng: If there are monks in a monastery, and she perceives that there are, and she enters it without asking permission of an available monk, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.2.pli: Sabhikkhuke vematikā santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā ārāmaṃ pavisati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.2.eng: If there are monks in a monastery, but she is unsure of it, and she enters it without asking permission of an available monk, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.3.pli: Sabhikkhuke abhikkhukasaññā santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā ārāmaṃ pavisati, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.3.eng: If there are monks in a monastery, but she does not perceive that there are, and she enters it without asking permission of an available monk, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.4.eng: If there are no monks in a monastery, but she perceives that there are, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.5.eng: If there are no monks in a monastery, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.6.eng: If there are no monks in a monastery, and she does not perceive that there are, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.2.eng: if she enters after asking permission of an available monk;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.3.eng: if, when there is no available monk, she enters without asking permission;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.4.eng: if she goes while looking at the head of a nun in front of her;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.4.comm: Sp 2.1027: Sīsānulokikāti paṭhamaṁ pavisantīnaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ sīsaṁ anulokentī pavisati, anāpatti, “Sīsānulokika means there is no offense if she enters while looking at the head of the nuns entering first.” The point, perhaps, is that she may assume that the nun in front has asked for permission.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.5.pli: yattha bhikkhuniyo sannipatitā honti tattha gacchati,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.5.eng: if she is going to where the nuns have gathered;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.6.eng: if a path goes through the monastery;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.10.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.11.eng: The first training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:0.5.eng: The training rule on abusing monks

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying  in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood near Vesālī,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato upālissa upajjhāyo āyasmā kappitako susāne viharati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.2.eng: Venerable Upāli’s preceptor, Venerable Kappita, was staying in a charnel ground.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyānaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ mahattarā bhikkhunī kālaṅkatā hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.3.eng: At that time the leader of the nuns from the group of six had just died.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.4.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo taṃ bhikkhuniṃ nīharitvā āyasmato kappitakassa vihārassa avidūre jhāpetvā thūpaṃ katvā gantvā tasmiṃ thūpe rodanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.4.eng: They took her to that charnel ground, cremated her near Venerable Kappita’s dwelling, and made a stupa. They then went there to cry.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmā kappitako tena saddena ubbāḷho taṃ thūpaṃ bhinditvā pakiresi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.5.eng: Venerable Kappita was disturbed by the noise, and so he demolished the stupa and scattered the rubble.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six thought,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.7.pli: “iminā kappitakena amhākaṃ ayyāya thūpo bhinno, handa naṃ ghātemā”ti mantesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.7.eng: “Kappita has demolished our Venerable’s stupa; let’s kill him,” and they laid a plan.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.8.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī āyasmato upālissa etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.8.eng: A certain nun told Venerable Upāli what was happening,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.9.pli: Āyasmā upāli āyasmato kappitakassa etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.9.eng: and he in turn told Venerable Kappita.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.10.pli: Atha kho āyasmā kappitako vihārā nikkhamitvā nilīno acchi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.10.eng: Venerable Kappita then left his dwelling and went into hiding.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.11.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo yenāyasmato kappitakassa vihāro tenupasaṅkamiṃsu;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.11.eng: Soon afterwards the nuns from the group of six went to his dwelling

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.12.pli: upasaṅkamitvā āyasmato kappitakassa vihāraṃ pāsāṇehi ca leḍḍūhi ca ottharāpetvā, “mato kappitako”ti pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.12.eng: and crushed it with rocks and lumps of earth. When they thought he was dead, they left.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.13.pli: Atha kho āyasmā kappitako tassā rattiyā accayena pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya vesāliṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.13.eng: The following morning Venerable Kappita robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Vesālī for almsfood.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.14.pli: Addasaṃsu kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo āyasmantaṃ kappitakaṃ piṇḍāya carantaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.14.eng: When the nuns from the group of six saw him,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.16.pli: “ayaṃ kappitako jīvati, ko nu kho amhākaṃ mantaṃ saṃharī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.16.eng: “Kappita is alive! Who spoiled our plan?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.20.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayaṃ kāsāvaṭo malamajjano nihīnajacco amhākaṃ mantaṃ saṃharissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.20.eng: “How could this barber, this dirt remover of inferior caste, spoil our plan?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.21.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.21.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.22.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo ayyaṃ upāliṃ akkosissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.22.eng: “How could the nuns from the group of six abuse Venerable Upāli?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.23.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo upāliṃ akkosantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.23.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.26.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo upāliṃ akkosissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.26.eng: “How could the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.28.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.28.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.29.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuṃ akkoseyya vā paribhāseyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.29.1.eng: ‘If a nun abuses or reviles a monk, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.1.8.pli: dasahi vā akkosavatthūhi akkosati etesaṃ vā aññatarena, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.1.8.eng: if she abuses with the ten kinds of abuse or with any one of them, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.1.10.eng: if she induces fear, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.1.pli: Upasampanne upasampannasaññā akkosati vā paribhāsati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.1.eng: If he is fully ordained, and she perceives him as such, and she abuses or reviles him, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.2.pli: Upasampanne vematikā akkosati vā paribhāsati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.2.eng: If he is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she abuses or reviles him, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.3.pli: Upasampanne anupasampannasaññā akkosati vā paribhāsati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.3.eng: If he is fully ordained, but she does not perceive him as such, and she abuses or reviles him, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.4.pli: Anupasampannaṃ akkosati vā paribhāsati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.4.eng: If she abuses or reviles someone who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.5.eng: If he is not fully ordained, but she perceives him as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.6.eng: If he is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.7.eng: If he is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive him as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.3.2.eng: if she is aiming at something beneficial;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.3.3.eng: if she is aiming at giving a teaching;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.3.4.eng: if she is aiming at giving an instruction;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.3.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.3.7.eng: The second training rule is finished.
